channel.title: Adding a NPC

item.title: Adding a NPC
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Guessing from the notes you’ve put in your code, I’d say you’ve tried to load models by using item-IDs instead - for example, your note which says //arms <<shield? is 1187, which is the same item-ID as a dragon sq shield. You’re supposed to put the model IDs there instead.
So if you wanted a drgaon sq shield, you would use 565 as the ID instead, because it’s the ID of the wield model for dragon sq shield.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a NPC
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Less of the attitude. He only asked where you placed your ints.

What are these?

	class5.anIntArray76 = new int[3];
	class5.anIntArray70 = new int[3];
	class5.anIntArray76[0] = 0xD4E7;
	class5.anIntArray76[1] = 0xDFC0;
	class5.anIntArray76[2] = 0xD3A7;
	class5.anIntArray70[0] = 8128;
	class5.anIntArray70[1] = 9126;
	class5.anIntArray70[2] = 8128;

I doubt they’re necessary?
Or are you recolouring some parts?

item.title: Adding a NPC
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

Okay I Was Making A New NPC And This Is Pretty Much What Happens?

BTW Here Is The Code If You Need To Modifiy.

if(i == 2) {
	class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
	class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack";
	class5.anIntArray94 = new int[9];
	class5.anIntArray76 = new int[3];
	class5.anIntArray70 = new int[3];
	class5.anIntArray76[0] = 0xD4E7;
	class5.anIntArray76[1] = 0xDFC0;
	class5.anIntArray76[2] = 0xD3A7;
	class5.anIntArray70[0] = 8128;
	class5.anIntArray70[1] = 9126;
	class5.anIntArray70[2] = 8128;
	class5.anIntArray94[0] = 1187; // arms << SHEILD?
	class5.anIntArray94[1] = 3140; // chest << PLATEBODY?
	class5.anIntArray94[2] = 4087; // legs << PLATELEGS?
	class5.anIntArray94[3] = 4587; // Weapon << WEAPON
	class5.anIntArray94[4] = 1837; // boots << BOOTS
	class5.anIntArray94[5] = 775; // gloves << GLOVES
	class5.anIntArray94[6] = 1149; // helm << HELMET
	class5.anIntArray94[7] = 1007; // cape << CAPE
	class5.anIntArray94[8] = 1478; // amulet << AMULET
	class5.anInt61 = 127; // Level
	class5.aString65 = "E-L33T DragonSlayer";
	class5.aByteArray89 = "E-L33t, Elite, Geddit?".getBytes();
}

The Ones With Question Marks Im Not Really Sure Of LOLFAIL…
I R TEH ONE IN TEH ORANGE!

Read full topic
